abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Rehabilitation
            Project for South Sudan were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Grantee performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: in hindsight, an in-depth
            discussion and the adoption of a common approach across
            Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDTF)- funded projects will have
            been beneficial, because many issues across projects or
            sectors were similar and related to state building and
            development of government systems, for example, the
            establishment of a civil service and ministry structures,
            and technical and fiduciary capacity building. Education
            Rehabilitation Project (ERP) will have benefit from a more
            rigorous assessment of project readiness for implementation,
            realism of its targets, and time frame. Building strong
            Monitoring and Evaluation (M and E) systems as integral part
            of project implementation from the start is essential It is
            vital to begin stakeholder dialogue early on and maintain it
            throughout preparation and implementation. This includes
            dialogue and regular communication with donors, but also
            beneficiaries and their communities. The project will have
            benefit from an even larger staff presence on the ground and
            intensified management guidance and support. State capacity
            building approach may slow down implementation initially,
            but will pay off in the medium to long term through enhanced
            ministry ownership and capacity.

repnme.cdata!:
South Sudan - Education Rehabilitation
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education
            Rehabilitation Project (ERP) for South Sudan is to improve
            access to enhanced quality of education, alternate learning
            opportunities, development of life skills and basic
            occupational skill training to primary school students,
            Irrigation Development Project's (IDPs), demobilized
            soldiers, and other non-traditional learners. The percentage
            of expenditure to be financed from the project will be
            amended to 100 percent from November 30, 2012 up to the
            Project closing date of December 31, 2012. The total Grant
            allocation of US$25.5 million and the full Government
            contribution of US$20.4 million have been transferred to the
            Project account and fully committed. However, as of November
            31, 2012, there are unexpended balances of US$1,499,197.38
            from the Grant and US$1,175,587.00 from the Government.
            While the percentage of expenditure to be financed by Multi
            Donor Trust Fund (MDTF) has been increased for all MDTF
            supported projects to an average of 75 percent, the only
            exception was ERP, which has been financed by only 56
            percent. This percentage will be further reduced, as it is
            unlikely for the full amount of the outstanding unspent
            balance from MDTF to be used by December 31, 2012. This is
            mainly due to the delay in the execution of one of the two
            contracts for the delivery of furniture to 27 of the 52
            schools built under the Project. Deliveries to all of these
            schools might not be completed within the closing date due
            to capacity of the supplier and the logistical challenges
            caused by the poor road network. Payments may subsequently
            not be made from the grant funds. The amendment is therefore
            necessary to increase the percentage of expenditure to be
            financed out of grant funds from the current 56 percentage
            to 100 percent for the period November 30 to December 31,
            2012 to allow for full disbursement of the grant funds and
            to allow for the Government contribution to be used for the
            payment of the remaining deliveries beyond December 31,
            2012, and thus providing more time for delivery.
            Recipient's request fulfills the general requirements
            for the extension of the closing date as indicated in OP 13.30.

display_title.display_title:
South Sudan - Education
            Rehabilitation Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

17081382.trustfund:
TF010264-South Sudan - Sector Plan Analysis,TF056452-SOUTHERN SUDAN EDUCATION
            REHABILITATION PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
South Sudan - Education Rehabilitation
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education
            Rehabilitation Project for South Sudan is to improve access
            to enhanced quality of education, alternate learning
            opportunities, development of life skills and basic
            occupational skill training to primary school students,
            Irrigation Development Project's (IDPs), demobilized
            soldiers, and other non-traditional learners. The extension
            is necessary to achieve the project development objective
            (PDO), through the completion of the following ongoing
            activities: final inspection and payment of the last and
            retention payments for the two completed schools and three
            county education centre's, whose defect liability
            period ends beyond June 30, 2012; provision of more time for
            the delivery of the school furniture, which has already been
            procured, to the respective schools; completion of the
            survey of alternative education system programs and
            intensive English course and closing the contracts. This
            will be the fourth extension of the project and will result
            into a cumulative extension of the project for 39 months
            from the original closing date.

            Rehabilitation Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
